summary:
Freelance AWS (engineer/ architect/devops) professional with 6.5+ years of experience, ranging from EC2 to Serverless, RDS to Glue data lakes, CodeBuild to CodePipeline and more.

GCP (engineer/devops) associate with 1 year of experience in Compute, Run, Kubernetes and Dataflow.

As a distinguishing feature I incorporate elements of data science and product ownership into my work. The combination allows me to track the performance of my solutions on a macro scale; outcomes are better tested and more tailored to what the business needs.

Check out my passion projects and thoughts at blog.brainfartlab.com

awards.title: iGEM Gold Medal Finalist
awards.description: Project "Dr. Coli" ended as a gold medal team among 17 other teams on a total of 84 teams from 21 countries in the International Genetically Engineered Machine (iGEM) contest.

publications.name: A SVD approach to multivariate polynomial optimization problems

profile_positions.description:
Architecture, implementation & maintenance of "Cloud Data Spaces", based on AWS Sagemaker Studio, integrated with SSO (Azure AD). Used by 50+ developers, data scientists & analysts to collaborate creating data products in a cost-monitored environment. Integration with AWS ServiceCatalog as a "vending machine" for provisioning resources in AWS (e.g. pipelines, scheduling, ...) and AWS MWAA (Airflow) for orchestration. Includes AWS API Gateway for interfacing.

Fully automated pipeline for propagating database structure changes in AWS Redshift from test to production, used by 10+ teams and 40+ developers. Synchronizes all environments and reduced deployment from days to minutes.

Fully automated CI/CD platform for deploying Glue/Lambda resources. Used by 10+ teams and 40+ developers, with personalized stacks for features. Reduced deployments from +4 hours to < 5 minutes.

Data quality products in AWS ServiceCatalog using AWS Deequ to provide metrics (freshness, record count, ...) on 900+ data products with anomaly detection. Development of a Python library to parse configurations to Deequ code.

Core infrastructure using CDK for AWS ServiceCatalog and VPC endpoints. Automatic uploading of files through MS Sharepoint into the AWS hosted data lake.

TypeScript CDK library to automatically apply naming, tagging conventions on AWS resources provisioned through CDK, using projen for cross-language compilation (Python, TypeScript) with JSII. Available in AWS CodeArtifact.
profile_positions.title: AWS Solution Architect

profile_positions.description:
Architecture & implementation of a chatbot backend integration for application tracking systems (ATS) guiding users through the application process. Focus on scheduling logic and bidirectional communication with Google spreadsheets for recruiters. Interface provided using AWS API Gateway.

Implementation of a work hour planning tool integrating with Salesforce. Consumption of push topics and platform events using TypeScript (Bayeux) on Lambda.

Development of a TypeScript CDK library to meet naming and tagging conventions of AWS provisioned resources automatically in CDK projects.
profile_positions.title: AWS Backend Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Architecture, implementation & maintenance of compliance frameworks using AWS Config, SSM to audit and remediate anomalous AWS resources cross-region and cross-account, using RTK. Contributed to networking, encryption analysis for penetration testing.

Architecture, implementation & maintenance of an AWS Redshift warehouse for billing data ingestion. Event driven ingestion of shipping data using API Gateway (hooks) & AWS Firehose. Glue implementations for various sources.

Synthetic big data generator Python library to generate vast sums of data for development testing of Glue/Lambda resources. Published as a CLI tool in AWS CodeArtifact with a plugin framework to add new sources.

Development of a ECS hosted data science model with Flask. Performance analysis with AWS X-Ray to reduce median latency by over 50%.

Cost optimization of S3 data access patterns (CloudTrail, Athena), saving 300+ EUR / day. Coding sessions with engineers in a hands-on manner on various topics (AWS, Python, ...)
profile_positions.title: AWS Big Data Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Architecture, implementation & maintenance of a data lake, ingesting 60+ terabyte-sized topics from Kafka (on-premise) using ECS/Fargate and Glue for updates. Implemented with CDK. Implementation of a Kafka Connect plugin written in Kotlin for sinking a Kafka topic into AWS Firehose at 5 MB/second.

Architecture, implementation & maintenance of an event driven pipeline to provide/correct coordinates of millions of hotels, aggregating 5+ geolocating services, responding to changes in address. Using Lambda, DynamoDB, RDS.

Architecture, implementation & maintenance of an event driven pipeline to assign hotels to destination using polygons hosted in AWS RDS (Aurora PostgresQL with PostGIS). Full world update in < 1 hour. Implementation of business logic for assignment in Python.

Architecture, implementation & maintenance of a framework in AWS to put data science models into production. Model versions are tracked and deployed with ECS, DynamoDB. Model runs and updates are communicated to Slack. Various MLOps services provided on EC2 for data scientists (commuter, papermill, mlflow).

Data quality checking framework to identify anomalies in data products, checking Kafka upstream vs downstream. Interfaces with Slack.
profile_positions.title: Cloud Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Development of algorithms for multivariate polynomial root-finding, an inherent nonlinear problem. High level concepts from mathematical fields such as algebraic geometry (plays a large role in for instance Andrew Wiles' proof of Fermat's Theorem) are translated into the linear algebra setting. This facilitates the design of algorithms with robust numerical properties and strategically placed rank tests, answering questions such as "How many solutions are there?" and "Which of these are the best?". The bridge formed between polynomial root-finding and linear algebra paves the way for global optimization strategies to nonlinear problems, extracting a single optimal solution from data in the process, a feature shared by none of the current state-of-the-art approaches.

Teaching assistant "Case Studies: Mathematical Engineering" (1st Master, Math. Eng.): organizing and inviting external speakers applying mathematics in industry, organizing and monitoring student debates.

Teaching assistant "System Identification" (1st Master, Math. Eng.): Course design, job student tutoring, demo programming, online platform, exercise sessions.
profile_positions.title: PHD Student

profile_positions.description: Project development, nicknamed Dr. Coli, of a bacterial drug delivery system as part of an interdisciplinary team in the context of synthetic biology in bioinformatics. Rigorous iterative design of pathway simulation models using SimBiology (Matlab). Web development and tools design for various team aspects. The project was presented at the International Genetically Engineered Machine (iGEM) contest at MIT, Cambridge, Massachusetts, USA.
profile_positions.title: Student participant

volunteer_experiences.description: During a span of three weeks I helped provide support for two-toed sloths, three-toed sloths, howler monkeys, kinkajous and many more. Main duties included feeding, cleaning, and keeping the animals stimulated by simulating their natural environment. On the side I helped out in many additional projects (handiwork, construction, scavenging, trapping insects as a food source, ...).

Helped with the renovation of the Dudley Arms, an iconic pub from 1888 located closely to the Tui Brewery, carried out by a great host. Tasks ranged from gardening, cleaning to beginner construction including but not limited to concrete pour, painting, scaffolding, isolation, guttering, ... In addition to working on the pub, I also helped out locals in the neighborhood with various tasks.

Spring preparation on a farm in the mountains near Shimoda on the Izu peninsula of Japan. Tasks included construction of ridges, preparing seedlings, planting, installing fences and scavenging. In addition I assisted in household chores like cooking, cleaning, ...
